data.title: Memphis Grizzlies Team News, Fixtures and Results - Page 2
data.meta_description: Get the latest Memphis Grizzlies news, team updates, fixtures and results right here.
data.text:
Former NBA player Darius Morris' cause of death REVEALED after his tragic passing at the age of 33

Morris - who played for the Los Angeles Lakers and Philadelphia 76ers among others - was found dead in his Los Angeles home last month, leaving the world of NBA in mourning.

NBA star Derrick Rose shows off BOLD new face tattoo... after getting his model wife Alaina's initials inked on his skin

The Memphis Grizzlies guard got inked over Memorial Day Weekend as the finished products were shared by California-based artist Jose Guijosa, a.k.a. Killer Tattoos - on Tuesday.

Former NBA player Darius Morris dies aged 33

Morris played for the Los Angeles Lakers and Clippers during his NBA career, as well as the Philadelphia 76ers, Memphis Grizzlies and Brooklyn Nets.

Devonte Graham jokes he no longer considers Michael Jordan the GOAT after the ex-Hornets owner offloaded him to New Orleans in 2021: 'Once I got traded, it became LeBron'

San Antonio Spurs star Devonte' Graham joked he no longer considers Michael Jordan the GOAT in basketball after the ex-Hornets owner traded him to the New Orleans Pelicans in 2021.

Ben Simmons cops another brutal blow as $53million-a-year Aussie NBA star endures season from hell

The Aussie has been slammed from pillar to post due to injury and doubts about his commitment since becoming the NBA's No.1 draft pick in 2016.

Gunshots are fired outside the Memphis Grizzlies' FedExForum during game vs Detroit Pistons... as police take three people into custody over alleged shooting which saw suspect 'aim for a man and miss'

There has been a shooting outside of the Memphis Grizzlies' FedEx Forum, police said. According to Action News 5 , police responded to a 'shots fired' call in the area.

Ben Simmons' injury hell continues as he is ruled out for the rest of the SEASON with ongoing back issue... and Nets say he'll 'consult specialists and explore treatment options'

On Thursday morning, Shams Charania reported that Simmons would not return due to a nerve impingement in his lower back.

Watch the terrifying moment NBA star Bismack Biyombo appears to COLLAPSE during timeout... leaving Thunder teammates rushing to his aid

The rest of the players and coaching staff immediately looked shocked as he fell back into the chairs at the side of the court, where he received immediate medical attention.

Shannon Sharpe reveals he 'blacked out' during infamous confrontation with Tee Morant at Memphis Grizzlies game last year as he brands the altercation 'one of the worst moments of my life'

'Honestly, when people say they black out, I believe them,' Sharpe told co-host Gilbert Arenas. 'I completely forgot I was at the game. I said, 'If one guy steps over that line, it's over.''

Memphis Grizzlies 'are set to trade Steven Adams to the Houston Rockets for Victor Oladipo and three second-round draft picks'... three months after the New Zealand center underwent season-ending knee surgery

The Memphis Grizzlies and Houston Rockets have agreed to trade guard Victor Oladipo and three second-round picks for center Steven Adams.

New York Knicks coach Tom Thibodeau celebrates his 500-win milestone by hailing friend and idol Bill Belichick: 'That's the mark of greatness... he's incredible'

Rather than revel in his own success, the 65-year-old Connecticut native instead used his press conference to hail Belichick's impact on his life. 'He's incredible,' the Knicks coach said.

Memphis Grizzlies' billionaire owner Robert Pera angers neighbors by turning home on super-wealthy Miami island into basketball arena with jumbotron blazing 24 hours-a-day

Memphis Grizzlies' tech billionaire owner Robert Pera, 45, is building a massive home on Miami's exclusive Star Island compete with a full size basketball arena.

Grizzlies guard Marcus Smart 'out for up to six weeks' with 'severe right ring finger injury' - despite scoring a three-pointer with it this week - in a huge blow to Memphis' playoff hopes after Ja Morant's end-of-season injury

Thursday's update from The Athletic's Shams Charania means that the 29-year-old, three-time NBA All-Defense First Team nominee won't return before mid-to-late February.

Marcus Smart incredibly drains three-pointer with a DISLOCATED FINGER before leaving the Grizzlies game against the Mavericks for treatment

The guard celebrated by raising his hand in the air and holding up three fingers, but only noticed that his ring finger was crooked when he saw it with his own eyes.

Grizzlies star Ja Morant ruled out for the SEASON after suffering shoulder injury in practice... Memphis guard to have surgery just WEEKS after returning from 25-game suspension

'Morant will undergo season-ending surgery and is expected to make a full recovery ahead of the 2024-25 season,' the team said. It was only last month that Morant returned from a 25-game suspension.

Darvin Ham says that he and the Lakers brass are 'all aligned' amid speculation that his job could be at risk... before the Lakers fall to the Grizzlies 127-113

Despite rumors that his role within the team could be at stake, Los Angeles Lakers coach Darvin Ham said that he isn't worried about his job security.

Grizzlies coach Taylor Jenkins LOSES IT as LeBron James appears to elbow Jaren Jackson Jr while battling for a loose ball... but the Lakers star avoids punishment despite his fury

In the middle of the third quarter, James and Jackson were battling it out for a loose ball on the floor when the Lakers legend seemingly threw an elbow in the Grizzlies star's direction.

Grizzlies star Ja Morant warms up with his adorable 4-year-old daughter Kaari before Memphis' game against the Toronto Raptors

Before Wednesday night's game against the Toronto Raptors, Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant brought his 4-year-old daughter, Kaari, onto the court with him for warmups.

Ja Morant dunks on 7-foot-4 Victor Wembanyama before going crazy in celebration as he leads the Grizzlies to win over the Spurs

Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant threw down the hammer on a man who is one foot, two inches taller than himself as the exclamation mark on an emphatic 106-98 victory over the Spurs.

Ja Morant slammed by former NBA player Chandler Parsons over controversial 'gun celebration' against New Orleans Pelicans

Former NBA player Chandler Parsons was critical of Ja Morant's controversial celebration after hitting an alley-oop against the New Orleans Pelicans.

Tom Brady's (final!) retirement, Lionel Messi's Miami madness, and Travis Kelce and Taylor Swift's whirlwind romance... the 10 biggest stories and scandals across American sports in 2023

Amid a year full of great and impressive sporting accomplishments, 2023 was equally a year of dramatic storylines and scandals. Here, we take a look through the top 10... so what tops the list?

Ja Morant still has the same group of friends around him after gun waving trouble, according to his father Tee... who describes his sons actions as 'a bad decision, but it wasn't a crime'

Memphis Grizzlies star Ja Morant has not made any changes to his circle of friends after being suspended 25 games for flashing firearms on live video multiple times.

Lil Wayne claims Ja Morant should be the face of the NBA once LeBron James retires, despite Grizzlies star's recent ban for flashing a gun and ongoing assault lawsuit

That is despite the Memphis Grizzlies star's disciplinary issues that recently saw him return from a 25-game suspension after a video of him flashing a handgun was posted online.

Skip Bayless says Ja Morant makes the Grizzlies 'a completely different team'... but warns he must celebrate 'maturely' because the NBA 'needs you to be a superstar'

Skip Bayless fired off several tweets in reaction to Memphis Grizzlies point guard Ja Morant's tremendous return to the court and game-winning basket against the New Orleans Pelicans.

Ja Morant shouts 'I kept receipts' in a dig at his critics as he sprints into the Grizzlies locker room to celebrate 31-point display in his NBA return against the Pelicans

Morant, 24, capped a triumphant season debut with a game-winning, buzzer-beating layup, as the visiting Memphis Grizzlies rallied to beat the New Orleans Pelicans 115-113.

Ja Morant admits he went through 'a lot of hard days' during 25-game suspension and thanks his Grizzlies 'brothers' as he gives his mom the perfect birthday present with Pelicans game winner

Morant capped a stirring, 34-point season debut with a spinning dribble in the lane to set up a crucial floater as time expired in Memphis' 115-113 win over the New Orleans Pelicans on Tuesday.

Ja Morant hits a stunning game winner and scores 34 points on his NBA return following 25-game ban as the Grizzlies guard overcomes booing to inspire comeback against the Pelicans

Morant stepped onto the court for the first time this season as Memphis took on the Pelicans in New Orleans after serving a 25-game suspension for gun play.

Ja Morant is BOOED in New Orleans as he returns for the Memphis Grizzlies after a 25-game suspension for flashing a gun on social media

Morant gears up for the first time this season as the Grizzlies take on the Pelicans in New Orleans. Without him at the helm, Memphis is currently 6-19, sitting 13th in the Western Conference.

Ja Morant arrives for his Memphis Grizzlies comeback in New Orleans after completing his 25-game suspension for gun play

The No. 2 pick overall in the 2019 draft and 2020 NBA Rookie of the Year has been suspended for a combined 33 games since he first was caught flashing a gun on social media on March 4.

Ja Morant's last chance saloon: As NBA star returns to the court TONIGHT after his 25-game ban, DailyMail.com takes a look at the checkered past of one of the sport's most tortured players - and why he MUST prove he's changed

A string of incidents have plagued the point guard's start to his NBA career, the latest of which - a second gun-flashing Instagram video - pulled his life in the league to screeching halt with a 25-game ban.

LeBron James tells Ja Morant to 'go be GREAT again' as Grizzlies star returns from second suspension for gun play amid Memphis' dismal 6-19 start

LA Lakers star LeBron James wants to see Memphis Grizzlies point guard Ja Morant return to greatness now that his second suspension for gun play has finally come to an end.

Ja Morant speaks out for the first time as his 25-game ban for gun play comes to an end: Grizzlies star admits he's made 'a lot of mistakes' and 'some that have not even been public'

Ja Morant is ready to admit to some errors in judgement. 'I've made a lot of mistakes,' the suspended Memphis Grizzlies guard said to media on Friday in his first press conference back.

Ja Morant appears in court with the suspended Grizzlies star set to testify against teenager he allegedly punched during pickup game... one week before his slated NBA return

Morant, who is nearing the end of a 25-game suspension for brandishing firearms in two separate viral videos earlier this year, is accused of attacking now-18-year-old Josh Holloway.

NBA commissioner Adam Silver plans to 'check in' with suspended Grizzlies star Ja Morant as he returns from 25-game ban for flashing gun in video: 'I'm the monitoring situation closely'

Memphis Grizzlies guard Ja Morant can expect a chat with Adam Silver in the coming days as he prepares to return from his 25-game suspension for flashing a handgun in a viral video.

NBA NOTEBOOK: Ja Morant's suspension didn't just cost him 25 games - it may have cost the Grizzlies their season... and the league MUST quash the Chris Paul-Scott Foster beef

JAKE NISSE - NBA NOTEBOOK: When Ja Morant was suspended 25 games last June after flashing a gun on video for a second time, it wasn't quite viewed as a season-breaker for the Grizzlies.

Rockets' Dillon Brooks accuses the Memphis Grizzlies of making him a 'scapegoat' after postseason spats with LeBron James and other stars

Houston Rockets small forward Dillon Brooks has claimed the Memphis Grizzlies made him the scapegoat after the team got eliminated from the playoffs last season, while also saying he....

James Harden suffers FOURTH straight loss since Clippers trade as Los Angeles falls to the Grizzlies - the NBA's second-worst team

Throughout Harden's four games in LA the Clippers are an astounding -67 when he is on the court compared to +24 when he's on the bench.

LeBron James and Dillon Brooks share staredown in Rockets' win over Lakers... as NBA stars reignite rivalry following last season's playoff clash

During the Memphis Grizzlies ' playoff run that ended with a defeat to the Lakers, Brooks earned a reputation as one of the league's most hard-nosed defenders and antagonizing characters.

Portland Trail Blazers center Robert Williams III 'is set to undergo potential season-ending surgery on his right knee' after limping out of loss to the Memphis Grizzlies

Williams may also have the option of opting for a smaller cleanup procedure that would likely only side him for two to three months, reports The Athletic.

Ja Morant's dad Tee has been a 'major driving force' in his off-court problems, Memphis Grizzlies insider claims... with the ex-college player accused of 'living like he's an NBA superstar'

Morant is currently serving a 25-game suspension without pay after he was seen brandishing firearms in two separate viral videos which sparked outrage earlier this year.

Rockets guard Dillon Brooks is fined $25,000 for 'recklessly making contact' with another player's groin area during preseason debut in Houston

The NBA has fined Houston Rockets guard Dillon Brooks $25,000 for 'recklessly making contact with Indiana Pacers center Daniel Thies in the groin area.'

American pro basketball players escape Hamas bombings in Israel

With 11 Americans already confirmed dead in Israel, US basketball players in the country are continuing to flee the ongoing Hamas attacks, with some reaching nearby Greece while others seek shelter.

American pro basketball players escape Hamas bombings in Israel in attempt to flee the country, with one reaching Greece and another sheltering with a friend near Tel Aviv

With 11 Americans already confirmed dead in Israel, US basketball players in the country are continuing to flee the ongoing Hamas attacks, with some reaching nearby Greece while others seek shelter.

Ja Morant returns to Grizzlies training for the first time since being slapped with 25-game ban by the NBA for flashing a firearm on Instagram live

The NBA suspended the 24-year-old Morant for 25 games without pay in June for brandishing a handgun in a viral video for the second time on Instagram in May. He'll be eligible to return on December 19.

Ja Morant will be allowed to practice and travel with the Memphis Grizzlies during his 25-game suspension after the guard was handed ban for flashing a firearm on Instagram

NBA Commissioner Adam Silver announced Morant's second suspension in June, making it clear the Memphis Grizzlies guard must stop his 'alarming' habit of flashing guns on social media.

NBA star Ja Morant is in trouble for HIS DECISIONS - and not his friends' - the Grizzlies guard's father, Tee, tells basketball camp as his son prepares to serve 25-game ban for flashing gun

Ja Morant's 25-game suspension from the NBA is his own fault - and not his friends' - the Memphis Grizzlies star's father, Tee, told younger players at a recent basketball camp.

Michael Oher: Fans spot Tuohy family in the background of Ja Morant rookie playing card as it skyrockets in value amid 'The Blind Side' drama

The Tuohys hit the headlines last week after Oher filed a petition accusing them of dishonesty by having him sign papers which made them his conservators almost two decades ago.

USA basketball and New York Knicks star Jalen Brunson goes PERFECT shooting 9-9 from the field to help secure a 98-88 victory over Spain in World Cup warmup

Jalen Brunson put together an absolutely standout performance for the United States as he put together a perfect night of shooting from the field in the team's biggest test so far this summer.

Memphis forward Jaren Jackson Jr. says Grizzlies 'just gotta navigate' Ja Morant's suspension

The Grizzlies will have to cope without Morant for the first 25 games of the upcoming season after he was suspended by the league for flashing a firearm on an Instagram live video.

Ja Morant gets massive new back and torso tattoos as the Memphis Grizzlies star pays tribute to Kobe Bryant and his own Nike signature sneaker line

Morant's tattoo artist, Andres Ortega, showed off all of the 23-year-old's massive new amount of ink on Instagram after flying to Miami this past Saturday to get the job done.

Ja Morant's 'close friend' faces arrest warrant in Tennessee over the pair's alleged 2022 altercation with teenager at Grizzlies guard's Memphis mansion: Suspended NBA star filed countersuit in April, claiming self defense

Ja Morant's chaotic offseason continued Tuesday with news that an arrest warrant has been issued for his close friend over a 2022 altercation the pair had with a teenager.

SUMMER LEAGUE ROUNDUP: Thunder and Jazz win in Salt Lake City as Tre Mann and GG Jackson lead all scorers on the night with 23 points

The Thunder and Jazz emerged victorious in their Salt Lake City Summer League games on Thursday night as both teams got strong contributions from their 2022 first-round picks.

Houston Rockets 'agree to add Dillon Brooks, Jock Landale, and trade for Patty Mills' in flurry of moves that see 'Josh Christopher and Keyon Martin Jr. depart'

The Houston Rockets have agreed to a four-year $80 million contract with shooting guard Dillon Brooks and also have reached terms on a four-year $32 million deal with Jock Landale

Trae Young says the NBA needs Zion Williamson and Ja Morant amid Pelican star's scandal with porn star Moriah Mills and the latter's gun shame

New Orleans Pelicans star Williamson is embroiled in a scandal after porn star Moriah Mills publicly attacked him on social media after the basketball player posted a picture of his pregnant girlfriend.

Ex-Celtics stars Kevin Garnett and Tony Allen warn Ja Morant that he has to 'put yourself around better to do better' after his 25-game ban for second 'gun' incident

The 23-year-old Morant was hit with the 25-game ban earlier this month after two incidents in as many months of him appearing to brandish a gun on an Instagram Live video.

Warriors have 'strong confidence' Draymond Green will re-sign, after bitter rivals the Grizzlies 'had genuine interest in the veteran before trading for Marcus Smart'

After recently declining the $27.6 million option for the final year of his contract in Golden State, the Warriors are said to believe Draymond Green will stay with the team on a new deal.

Marcus Smart pens emotional farewell to Boston after trade calling the city 'a very special place' but says he 'can't wait to get to Memphis and get started'

Marcus Smart penned a lengthy goodbye to the city of Boston after he was traded away from the Celtics earlier this week. Smart the key piece in a deal that saw Boston acquire Kristaps Porzingis.

Memphis Grizzlies AGREE with Ja Morant's 25-game ban for his second pistol-waving incident as GM Zach Kleiman says: 'There's many really serious steps he needs to take'

Memphis Grizzlies believe Ja Morant's 25-game suspension for a second pistol-waving incident on social media was correct.

NBA Draft 2023 RECAP: Victor Wembanyama unsurprisingly goes as No 1 overall with Brandon Miller and Scoot Henderson second and third

Relive all the action from the 2023 NBA Draft with Mail Sport's live blog, as we found out to find out where the best young talent is headed on a huge night in Brooklyn...

Footage emerges of Ja Morant claiming the gun he waved in social media video was FAKE and actually a LIGHTER - before NBA banned him for 25 games for second pistol incident

Morant apparently sent his family a clip the day after video of him waving a pistol in a car emerged, demonstrating that the gun was actually a lighter as he uses it to light candles.

Nike says it WON'T cut ties with Ja Morant after 25-game ban while NBPA slam 'excessive and inappropriate' punishment for pistol-waving star

Nike will not be cutting ties with Ja Morant after the Grizzlies star was handed a 25-game suspension from the NBA for a second gun-waving offense this year.

'Nobody believes you, bro': Stephen A. Smith says Ja Morant's past lies about gun issues means that he now needs to 'show and prove' he's changed

ESPN's Stephen A. Smith is apprehensive that Memphis Grizzlies guard Ja Morant will show signs of dedication to improving his relationship with firearms.

Ja Morant SUSPENDED 25 games by the NBA to start the 2023-24 season for second pistol waving incident on social media

Memphis Grizzlies star guard Ja Morant has been suspended for 25 games by the league to begin the 2023-24 season, according to reports.

Jerry West admits he could have signed Kobe Bryant to the Memphis Grizzlies in 2003, but told the late Lakers legend 'no' because he belonged in LA

Basketball Hall of Fame inductee Jerry West recently made an admission that he could have signed Kobe Bryant to the Memphis Grizzlies back during the 2003 offseason.

Houston Rockets 'could join the bidding for Kyrie Irving in free agency if James Harden snubs emotional return and stays with the 76ers'

The Houston Rockets are said to be planning to make a serious attempt at signing free agent point guard Kyrie Irving this offseason, according to NBA reporter Marc Stein.

Tennessee man pleads guilty to helping two suspects accused of gunning down rapper Young Dolph in daytime ambush inside Memphis cookie store

Jermarcus Johnson, 26, from Tennessee, has admitted three counts of accessory after the fact over the November 2021 murder which took place outside Makeda's Homemade Cookies.

NBA commissioner Adam Silver pokes fun at Grizzlies star Ja Morant ahead of looming firearm suspension, saying farcical league PSA about players 'carrying' would have 'double meaning'

NBA commissioner Adam Silver has taken a hard line with Ja Morant as he weighs a firearm-related ban for the Grizzlies star - but that doesn't mean he's incapable of laughing about the situation.

Ja Morant is doing 'good,' Grizzlies Jaren Jackson Jr. reveals - as troubled Memphis star waits punishment from NBA for flashing another gun on social media

Memphis Grizzlies star Jaren Jackson Jr. gave an insight into the mindset of his currently suspended teammate Ja Morant. Morant has been suspended by the Grizzlies since mid-May.

Ja Morant not being charged with a crime for twice brandishing a gun on social media will not impact the NBA's discipline of troubled Memphis guard

Memphis guard Ja Morant not being charged with a crime for twice displaying a gun on social media will not prevent the NBA from handing down more discipline, Commissioner Adam Silver said Friday.

Adam Silver says ruling on Ja Morant will be announced AFTER the NBA Finals following Grizzlies star's second pistol-waving incident on social media

NBA commissioner Adam Silver announced Thursday that the league will wait until after the completion of the Finals to discipline Memphis Grizzlies star guard Ja Morant.

'It's just a phase': Ja Morant's friend and award-winning rapper Moneybagg Yo reveals he has spoken to NBA star amid latest gun controversy - and Grizzlies star told him 'Ima get it right'

Multi-award-winning artist MoneyBagg Yo gave weighed in on the ongoing Ja Morant situation during an interview with Complex.

Cops perform welfare check on NBA star Ja Morant after he sparked fears with 'bye' Instagram post in the wake of latest gun controversy... but police say he is 'fine' and taking social media break

The since-deleted messages, which come 11 days after his second gun scandal, were shared to his Instagram and addressed his sister, mom, dad and daughter before a final post said 'bye.'

'Do y'all know that boy? Cause I don't': Legendary rapper Lil Wayne hits back at Ja Morant gun criticism and claims those speaking out against NBA superstar only know him from 'dunking and jumping'

Legendary rapper and four-time Grammy award winning artist Lil Wayne weighed in on the on-going Ja Morant situation during an appearance on Showtime's 'All The Smoke' Podcast.

Ja Morant is urged to reassess his priorities after latest pistol-waving incident by Gilbert Arenas - the man who served a 50-game NBA ban for bringing guns into the Wizards' locker room

The Memphis Grizzlies star remains suspended by the team indefinitely from all basketball activities after he was seen waving a pistol on Instagram Live again last week.

Ja Morant is warned that 'notable LA gang member is ticked off at him portraying himself as a hip-hop street gangster' in NBA star's latest pistol-waving incident

The suspended Memphis Grizzlies point guard, whose shoe deal with Nike is in jeopardy, is facing a potentially lengthy NBA suspension and could see his $193million deal with the Grizzlies up in flames.

Ja Morant's signature shoe is REMOVED from Nike's website and some apps after second pistol-waving incident in as many months

Ja Morant's signature shoe is no longer listed for sale on Nike's website or the company app. The Ja 1 includes multiple colorway options and a staggered release of additional models.
